alert.note: Alert for Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 12:07AM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pickens County through 100 AM CDT... At 1206 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Steens, or near Columbus, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. A wind gust to 44 mph was recently recorded at Columbus Air Force Base. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Reform, Ethelsville, North Pickens Airport, McShan, Forest, Macedonia and Shaw. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
